page.title: 02Heltor Rock Heltor Dartmoor
page.content: {Heltor Rock,}located in 02790087, is a very fine granite outcrop commanding superb views from its peak at about 350 metres above sea level. To the north it overlooks the{Teign River {gorge}and some forty kilometres beyond. To the southwest and west it looks over farmland towards {Blackingstone Rock}some 3 km distant, and beyond some 11 km further{Haytor {Rocks}can be seen. All are granite tors formed largely by wind and weather erosion. Common flora are heather, knapweed, cow parsley, foxglove, blackberry, black thorn, wood woundwort, elderberry, thistle, gorse and fern. Granite of which all the tors are formed is used for gateposts, walls between fields, and farm buildings.
